author: Special Correspondent
text:
They seek a scheme on the lines of the one for the Ganga

The Centre must take steps to clean the Cauvery on the lines of the Ganges, the Akila Bharatha Ascetics Conference has stressed.

In a resolution passed at the meet being at the Panduranga Ashram at Govindapuram near here on the sidelines of the ongoing Mahamaham 2016, the participating heads of mutts and ashrams as ascetics of various orders called upon the Centre to take steps to nationalise all rivers and move forward to at least link all peninsular rivers. The resolution demanded that the Centre must allocate special funds to cleanse the Cauvery on the lines of the project to clean the Ganga.

The meet demanded that the Centre and the State governments must fund the Hindu Kailash Yatris like they do for those Muslims who undertake the Haj and the Christians who want to visit Jerusalem.

The three-day conference that ended on Saturday wanted the Centre to declare Kumbakonam as Heritage City and extend all due benefits for the welfare of the pilgrims and townsmen.
title: Clean up Cauvery: mutt leaders
